result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathan L. SHIELDS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: PTC Deliver Cocaine-2nd and subsequent offense (<=1g)

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Full-time employment, schooling or a combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
If agent finds the Phoenix assessment adequate, no AODA assessment; if not, defendant must undergo another AODA assessment.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law.  Six (6) months served up front, three (3) months stayed to be imposed at agent's discretion.  Huber is to include child care and schooling release.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnathan L. SHIELDS

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request and Response Re: Copies emailed to DOJ

The State moves to delete the repeater enhancer on count 2.  Motion granted.
GUILTY plea entered to the amended charge in count 2, deliver cocaine.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1 and 3.  Motion granted.
Sentencing is set for 06-07-16 at 11:00 a.m.
Court orders the defendant to submit to a DNA sample.
Minutes.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Status hearing is set for 03-31-2016 at 10:50 a.m., Br. 1.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 02-18-16 at 3:30 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of PTC deliver cocaine (2+) and 2 counts of deliver cocaine (2+).  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-25-16 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, defendnat is not to possess controlled substances unless he has a prescription for them, taken as prescribed and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Warrant returned with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
RE:  PTC deliver cocaine-2nd or subsequent offense, on 02-11-15.
